title: Portfolio
text:
Link: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/data/2021/2021-01-26/readme.md
Description: The dataset is gathered through organized plastic waste audits and clean-up events on a global scale. This dataset holds record of the date, location, brand name, types of plastic, and quantity.
Questions:
1.How does branded plastics compare to unbranded plastics collected?
2.Which brands were most associated with the plastic found?
3.Which plastics types were more commonly found? Which is the least?

title: Portfolio
text:
Link: https://github.com/rfordatascience/tidytuesday/blob/main/data/2021/2021-01-26/readme.md
Description: The dataset is gathered through organized plastic waste audits and clean-up events on a global scale. This dataset holds record of the date, location, brand name, types of plastic, and quantity.
Questions:
1.How does branded plastics compare to unbranded plastics collected?
2.Which brands were most associated with the plastic found?
3.Which plastics types were more commonly found? Which is the least?

title: Portfolio
text:
Data Cleaning
I created a binary variable using the “parent company” variable to have values either unbranded or branded per trash count. I also grouped parent companies and summarized the total count to look at the top ten companies linked to the trash collected. I also wanted to pivot some column titles to become values in a new variable called “type”.

title: Portfolio
text:
Data Visualization
Visualization 1
Here is a visual showing plastic counts found with or without an associated brand. On the left we have the branded counts in purple which we can observe a value that exceeds 5,000,000 counts. On the right side, we have unbranded counts in yellow which we can observe over 3,000,000 counts.





Figure. Total plastic counts between plastics that was found branded (Purple bar) or unbranded (Yellow bar).




Visualization 2
Here is a visual showing the top ten companies associated with the highest counts of plastic collected in descending order. The company associated with the highest count is La Doo with 15000 counts. Majority of the companies are food and beverage type companies or some type of personal care.





Figure. This is a bar graph that shows the top ten companies associated with the plastic collected in the survey.




Visualization 3
Here is a visual that displays the counts of plastic types. We can see the plastic type most commonly found was categorized as other. The plastic type found the least was categorized as Polyvinyl Chloride which is a non-recyclable type of plastic.





Figure. Boxplot overlayed on a violin plot that shows the log counts of plastic types collected

title: About Me
text: Bianca Rodas graduated from California State University, Monterey Bay with a B.S. in Marine Science and a statistics minor.

title: Bianca Rodas
text:
Volunteer/ Outreach
Volunteen, June-August 2019
The Aquarium of the Pacific, Long Beach, CA

Educated guests about the exhibits, the organisms, and the conservation practices for the safety of the ecosystems, with an emphasis on hands-on learning.
Facilitated tabling events to engage with guests and assisted at touch tanks to promote safe interactions with live marine organisms.

Teacher Assistant, September 2022- December 2022
Marina Vista Elementary School, Marina, CA

Assisted teacher in delivering an interactive lesson on writing and grammar for 2nd-grade students.
Organized and led small group activities to improve student comprehension in mathematics and develop problem-solving skills for 3rd-grade students.
Fostered a positive and inclusive learning environment for both classrooms by encouraging student participation and growth.

Volunteer Educator, October 2024-December 2024
The Monterey Bay Aquarium, Monterey, CA

Assisted in the cleaning and setting up of the lab programs, ensuring all materials were ready for student activities.
Facilitated educational sessions on STEM programs for deep-sea exploration and engaged students in hands-on learning experiences.
Led interactive discussions to encourage curiosity and critical thinking.
